content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and creative contribution!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and challenging!

I loved this.
I only have one nitpick. I feel the output format is not consistent. "yes" is all lower-case but "No" is capitalized. I feel "No" should be "no" OR "yes" should be "Yes".
Besides this minor detail, it's a really good contribution.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This Clash of Code is very enjoyable. It can be solved in under 15 minutes, and is very fun to code. Really hope this gets approved!
How about a test with an empty stage? I.e. just dots

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary outputs should be avoided for clashes. That's exactly the issue with your clash, as it allows only two possible answers (either "Yes" or "No"). Please modify the output requirement to allow for more than two possible answers.

Goal
* Please format "T", "G", "J" and "M" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* Please change "`Game Rules`" to "<<Game Rules>>" (i.e. format the text in bold instead of monospace).

Input
* Please format ".", "T", "G", "J" and "M" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

Output
* Please format "Yes" and "No" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

Constraints
* Please change 20 to 10.

Stub generator
* Please use different variable names in Line 2 and Line 3.

Cases
* To be reviewed after the binary output issue has been resolved.

Thanks.

Thank you for following up. Below is an updated list of points based on the revised contribution:

Goal
* The first paragraph is slightly confusing because it mixes perspectives and goals: it says "you must decide when to jump", but the actual task is to determine whether the player can reach the end given predefined actions. It also alternates between "you", "your character", and "the player".

  Suggested minimal edit: Rephrase the paragraph to consistently use "the player" and clarify that actions are given as input:

  • change "playing" to "given".

  • change "Your character" to "The player".

  • change "you must decide when to jump to avoid enemies and collect power-ups" to "and their actions (jump or walk) are predefined".

* Please clarify how far the player moves when walking or jumping.

Cases
* Please add a new pair of cases where the player jumps at a mushroom point.

Thanks.

P.S. Just a reminder that in order for me or others to be notified of your replies, you'll need to reply to an existing comment rather than starting a new one.

Happy New Year to you too.

Goal
* Consider adding the following after "(jump or walk)" for clarity:

The action may affect the outcome at that position (see the encounters below), but it does not move the player.

Cases
* Please move Pair 4 and Pair 5 to the end (as the cases should be ordered by complexity).

Thanks.
Thank you for your quick response.
